exclusion:
ZSO7300 is a SmartStart enabled product and can be added into a Z-Wave network by scanning the Z-Wave QR Code present on the product with a controller providing SmartStart inclusion. No further action is required and the

SmartStart product will be added automatically within 10 minutes of being switched on in the network vicinity.

Find the QR code and PIN Code under the pushbutton cover (Figure 6a). Find the full DSK on the product packaging or next to QR code.

Add ZSO7300 to a network with Classic Inclusion by pressing once on the switch (I) behind the pushbutton-cover

The LED will start blinking blue when the adding process is started.

Use same procedure for removing ZSO7300 with Classic Exclusion.

If ZSO7300 already belongs to a Z-Wave network, the remove process must be performed before adding it in a new network. Otherwise, the adding of the device will fail.
inclusion:
ZSO7300 is a SmartStart enabled product and can be added into a Z-Wave network by scanning the Z-Wave QR Code present on the product with a controller providing SmartStart inclusion. No further action is required and the

SmartStart product will be added automatically within 10 minutes of being switched on in the network vicinity.

Find the QR code and PIN Code under the pushbutton cover (Figure 6a). Find the full DSK on the product packaging or next to QR code.

Add ZSO7300 to a network with Classic Inclusion by pressing once on the switch (I) behind the pushbutton-cover. The LED will start blinking blue when the adding process is started.

Use same procedure for removing ZSO7300 with Classic Exclusion.

If ZSO7300 already belongs to a Z-Wave network, the remove process must be performed before adding it in a new network. Otherwise, the adding of the device will fail.
label: ZSO7300
overview: ZSO7300 is a smart multifunction socket outlet designed to control electrical appliances via Z-Wave network that can be mounted in a modular wall-box. It is compatible with existing FUGA® frames and wall boxes

category.label: Power Outlet
category.description: Small devices to be plugged into a power socket in a wall which stick there

parameters.label: Parameter 1, Parameter size 1 byte. Startup relay state
parameters.overview:
This parameter specifies the state of relay when device is turned on or restarts for some reason (power outage for

example).

options.label: Relay will be set off and load powered off
Relay will be set on and load powered on
Relay will be set to last state registered before restart

parameters.label: Parameter 2, Parameter size 1 byte. Meter report time.
parameters.overview: This parameter specifies how often meter reports are sent via association group 1.

options.label: Meter reports are never sent.
Report time in seconds. (Default is 60 seconds).
Report time in minutes (minus 127) from 1 – 128 minutes, where 128 is

parameters.label: Parameter 3, Parameter size 2 byte. Watt change threshold
parameters.overview:
The following value determines how much the Watt consumption should change to initiate an unsolicited report to

the controller to be aware of rapid power consumption changes.

options.label: Correspond to Watts (Default is 50 W)

parameters.label: Parameter 4, Parameter size 2 byte. Watt power off threshold
parameters.overview:
As a safety mechanism it is possible to turn off relay if power consumption gets higher than the defined threshold.

This parameter specifies the number of Watts measured which will trigger relay off. If this event occurs device will

turn of relay and will start blinking until Button is pushed on the device or Basic Set command is sent to it.

options.label: Correspond to Watts (Default is 2900 W)

parameters.label: Parameter 5, Parameter size 1 byte. LED mode.

options.label: Basic- When off no light in the LED, when on Green LED.
Power consumption: LED indication OFF color is determined by Parameter
User defined colors: When this mode is used, then ON and OFF colors wi

parameters.label: Parameter 6, Parameter size 4 bytes. LED ON RESERVED
parameters.overview:
This parameter specifies the color levels for the red, green, and blue colors in the RGB LED. This parameter is not

used unless configuration parameter #5 is set to the value 2. The default configuration is a green light

parameters.label: Parameter 6, Parameter size 4 bytes. LED ON BLUE color indication.

options.label: Specifies the level for the blue color. (Default is 255)

parameters.label: Parameter 6, Parameter size 4 bytes. LED ON GREEN color indication.

options.label: Specifies the level for the green color. (Default is 255)

parameters.label: Parameter 6, Parameter size 4 bytes. LED ON RED color indication.

options.label: Specifies the level for the red color. (Default is 0)

parameters.label: Parameter 7, Parameter size 4 bytes. LED OFF RESERVED color indication.
parameters.overview:
This parameter specifies the color levels for the red, green, and blue colors in the RGB LED. This parameter is not

used unless configuration parameter #5 is set to the value 1 or 2. The default configuration is a purple light.

parameters.label: Parameter 7, Parameter size 4 bytes. LED OFF BLUE color indication.
parameters.overview:
This parameter specifies the color levels for the red, green, and blue colors in the RGB LED. This parameter is not

used unless configuration parameter #5 is set to the value 1 or 2. The default configuration is a purple light.

options.label: Specifies the level for the blue color. (Default is 255)

parameters.label: Parameter 7, Parameter size 4 bytes. LED OFF  Green color indication.
parameters.overview:
This parameter specifies the color levels for the red, green, and blue colors in the RGB LED. This parameter is not

used unless configuration parameter #5 is set to the value 1 or 2. The default configuration is a purple light.

options.label: Specifies the level for the green color. (Default is 0)

parameters.label: Parameter 7, Parameter size 4 bytes. LED OFF RED color indication.
parameters.overview:
This parameter specifies the color levels for the red, green, and blue colors in the RGB LED. This parameter is not

used unless configuration parameter #5 is set to the value 1 or 2. The default configuration is a purple light

options.label: Specifies the level for the red color. (Default is 143)

parameters.label: Parameter 8, Parameter size 1 byte. LED brightness level.
parameters.overview: This parameter determines the actual brightness level of the LED in percent

options.label: Percent light brightness in the indicator LED. (Default is 10, which m

parameters.label: Parameter 8, Parameter size 1 byte. LED brightness level.
parameters.overview:
This parameter specifies if commands are transmitted as a secure message for each of the association groups.

This parameter is only used when the device is included in security mode (either S0 or S2)

options.label: All messages in all groups are sent as insecure.
Messages in association group 2 are sent as secure
Messages in association group 3 are sent as secure.
All messages in all groups are sent as secure. (Default)

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.overview:
Sends Device Reset notifications, Meter Reports, Indicator Reports, Binary Switch reports,

Notification Event Power Management

associations.label: Basic Report
associations.overview:
Nodes in this group receives Basic Report with the actual state of the binary switch (relay). It

can be used by other devices to update their internal states and can be used in multi-way

switching configurations for ensuring that all controlling devices has an updated status.

associations.label: Basic Set
associations.overview:
Nodes in this group receives a Basic Set command whenever the ZSO button is used to

switch the relay ON or OFF. It is the actual state of the relay that is sent in the Basic Set

command. This group is NOT used when the relay state is changed by means of Z-Wave

commands (as this would result in a kind of self-oscillation and jam the Z-Wave network).

So, it will be possible to have two (or more) ZSO’s associated with each other by using this

group, to have the relay state synchronized when the ZSO buttons are used.
